sourceDesc.p: Converted from a Word document written by Nick D'Amore

list.item: convert those “,” things to just comma

body.p: Some ice organ-pipes at the Cliffs. They appear to be formed of successive rings about half an inch thick and diameter lessening with more or less regularity to the point: [image] Sometimes the point is split in two. Then the rocks are incased with ice under which water flows, –thin sheets of rippling water frozen as it flowed, —and, with the sun, again apparently thawing beneath and giving room to a new sheet of water, for under the south side of the rocks it melts almost every day.”
PE 9, pg. 151 / 3 Sept 1854- 12 May 1855 / NNPM MA 1302:24 / T vol. # XVIII / PDF # XIII
